title: Space Force and intelligence agencies seek to streamline satellite imagery delivery
summary: A "joint mission management center" has been set up at the National Geospatial-Intelligence Agency’s campus in Springfield, Virginia

title: U.S. intelligence agency to evaluate trustworthiness of AI models
summary: The National Geospatial Intelligence Agency is creating a standardized framework for evaluating the accuracy of computer vision models used to analyze satellite imagery and other geospatial data

title: Vega for ESA: the story
summary: Vega joined the family of launch vehicles at Europe’s Spaceport in French Guiana in 2012. At 30-m tall the rocket weighs 137 tonnes on the launch pad and reaches orbit with three solid-propellant powered stages before the fourth liquid-propellant stage takes over. By rocket standards Vega is lightweight and powerful, the first three stages burn through their fuel and bringing Vega and its satellites to space in just six minutes.

title: Evolution Space tests rocket on Spaceport Company sea-based platform
summary: The solid propulsion test vehicle reached an altitude of 55,500 feet.

title: ESA for Vega: the story
summary: Vega joined the family of launch vehicles at Europe’s Spaceport in French Guiana in 2012. title: Opportunities with ESA at Big Science Business Forum 2024
summary: ESA is part of the Big Science Business Forum 2024 event on 1–4 October in Trieste, Italy. This is where industry and Europe’s leading science organisations, research infrastructures and their collaborators will meet to inform, network and discuss business opportunities in a market valued at nearly €10 billion annually.

title: Sentinel-2C operators complete final rehearsals
summary: ESA mission controllers have completed the final phase of their simulation training for the critical launch and early orbit phase, confirming that everything is ready for the launch of Sentinel-2C.

title: NASA moving ahead with Europa Clipper launch in October
summary: NASA in on track to clear the Europa Clipper spacecraft for a launch attempt next month after concluding that electronics on the spacecraft can handle the planned mission profile.

title: Mission control GO for Sentinel-2C launch
summary: Mission control GO for Sentinel-2C launch

title: China launches new set of classified Yaogan-43 satellites
summary: HELSINKI — China launched a second group of classified Yaogan-43 satellites late Monday, adding to a group of nine satellites already in orbit. A Long March 4B rocket lifted off […]
